CrochetMatic

Jan. – Aug. 2019

Introduction

TODO

Overview

1. Designing 3D Stitch Models
2. Initial Design
3. Low-Fidelity Prototypes
4. Initial High-Fidelity Prototype
5. Final High-Fidelity Prototype
6. Reflection & Future Work

This project was done in collaboration with Steve Marschner. We also worked with François Guimbretière and Amrit Kwatra, who worked on building the physical CrochetMatic system.

Designing 3D Stitch Models

constructing 3D stitch mesh-like polyline block models in Blender and a pipeline to convert these models into B-splines

Converting Polylines to B-Splines

Results

Once I had the block models in the compatible B-spline format for the yarnsim simulator, developed by PhD students in the lab, I ran the simulation with my CrochetMatic inputs. The three column model is shown below.

); } } export default Crochetmatic;
